description: From Latin demersus, past participle of dēmergō (“to sink”); compare demersed.

adjectives.description: demersal (comparative more demersal, superlative most demersal)

entries.meaning: (biology) That lives near the bottom of a body of water.
examples: At a certain age, however, the Cape horse mackerel in the northern Benguela tend to adopt a more demersal lifestyle, thus entering into the bottom dead zone.

entries.meaning: Taking place near the bottom of a body of water.
